subject: Medicine
title: Joseph Lister and Antiseptics
description: Learn Joseph Lister and Antiseptics in one minute.

hook.text: Half of surgery patients died from infection in the 1860s. Surviving the operation was the easy part.

buildup.text: Joseph Lister read Pasteur's germ theory and wondered: what if we killed germs before they entered wounds?

discovery.text: He sprayed carbolic acid on surgical instruments and wounds. Infection rates plummeted.

twist.text: Surgeons mocked him. They operated in street clothes with unwashed hands and considered it normal.

climax.text: Within a decade, antiseptic surgery became standard. Lister saved more lives than any surgeon before him.

punchline.text: Clean surgery was a revolution, not a detail.

quiz.question: What inspired Lister to develop antiseptic surgery?
options: The invention of new surgical instruments
A government mandate for hospital cleanliness
